intro: Dryopsis maximowicziana, commonly known as the red-stemmed dryopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its vibrant flowers, typically in shades of red or purple, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
